message.content:
cs.HC, cs.CV, cs.CL, cs.MM, cs.IR 

The paper discusses an experimental study on the efficiency and usability of oral system messages combined with visual modalities for helping users locate objects on crowded displays rapidly. This topic is related to human-computer interaction (cs.HC) and computer vision (cs.CV) as it involves the use of visual modalities for object recognition. The study also involves the use of speech recognition and natural language processing (cs.CL) for the oral system messages. Additionally, the study involves multimodal input and output (cs.MM) and information retrieval (cs.IR) as it aims to improve the efficiency of visual search tasks. Therefore, the most likely sub-categories are cs.HC and cs.CV, followed by cs.CL, cs.MM, and cs.IR.
